diagnoses.name: Behcet's Disease
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disorder affecting multiple parts of the body, including the blood vessels. This condition can cause mouth and genital ulcers, eye inflammation, and could potentially lead to vascular problems like aneurysms.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disease where the body's immune system attacks its own tissues, causing widespread inflammation and tissue damage in the affected organs, potentially leading to symptoms like ulcers and aneurysms.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.description: A rare genetic condition causing severe swelling (angioedema) in various parts of the body, including the larynx, which may be related to laryngitis symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Marfan Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder that affects the body's connective tissue, leading to abnormalities in the heart, blood vessels (increasing the risk of aneurysms), eyes, and bones.

diagnoses.name: Hughes-Stovin Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare vascular disorder that is characterized by the formation of aneurysms and venous thrombosis along with multiple pulmonary and systemic manifestations.

diagnoses.name: Polyarteritis Nodosa
diagnoses.description: A serious blood vessel disease where small and medium-sized arteries become swollen and damaged, potentially leading to aneurysms and affecting organs such as the skin, kidneys, and nerves.

diagnoses.name: Adamantiades-Behçet's Disease
diagnoses.description: Another nomenclature for Behcet's disease, focusing on its wide-ranging impact on the body, including vascular, mucosal, and skin manifestations.

diagnoses.name: Cogan's Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare form of vasculitis that can lead to inflammation of the ears and eyes, potentially causing hearing loss and vision problems, with associated vascular symptoms like aneurysms.

diagnoses.name: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis
diagnoses.description: An uncommon disorder where blood vessel inflammation restricts blood flow to various organs, potentially leading to symptoms like ulcers and organ damage.

diagnoses.name: Loeys-Dietz Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A genetic disorder affecting the connective tissue in the body. It is characterized by the formation of aneurysms in various arteries, along with other features like hypertelorism (widely spaced eyes) and cleft palate or bifid uvula.

diagnoses: Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (EGPA, formerly Churg-Strauss Syndrome)
Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Larynx
Autoimmune diseases (e.g., Systemic Lupus Erythematosus, Rheumatoid arthritis)
Endocrine disorders (e.g., Thyroid disease, Addison's disease)
Chronic infections (e.g., Hepatitis, Chronic fungal infections)

diagnoses.name: Chronic Myeloid Leukemia
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that starts in certain blood-forming cells of the bone marrow. It can lead to a wide variety of symptoms, including anemia, fatigue, and weight loss, and potentially influence blood levels, causing conditions like polycythemia.

diagnoses.name: Celiac Disease
diagnoses.description: An autoimmune disorder where the ingestion of gluten leads to damage in the small intestine, causing malabsorption, weight loss, and bloating.

diagnoses.name: Sarcoidosis
diagnoses.description: An inflammatory disease that affects multiple organs in the body, but mostly the lungs and lymph glands. Symptoms can include fatigue, weight loss, and leukopenia.

diagnoses.name: Whipple Disease
diagnoses.description: A rare bacterial infection that primarily affects the small intestine. It can lead to malabsorption, abdominal pain, and other systemic symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Polycythemia Vera
diagnoses.description: A type of blood cancer that causes the bone marrow to make too many red blood cells. This can lead to thickened blood and symptoms like headaches, dizziness, and swelling of the hands and feet.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, including the skin, joints, and organs. Symptoms are varied and can include leukopenia and edema.

diagnoses.name: Common Variable Immune Deficiency
diagnoses.description: An immunodeficiency disorder that can lead to a high susceptibility to infections, including those that may lead to chronic congestion and other respiratory symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A group of blood cancers that develop in the lymph system. Depending on the type and stage, symptoms can include weight loss, fevers, and possible leukopenia due to bone marrow involvement.

diagnoses.name: Heart Failure
diagnoses.description: A chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should, which can lead to migratory edema and other symptoms.

diagnoses.name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
diagnoses.description: A chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet. While mainly known for its effects on the joints, it can also cause systemic symptoms and affect organ systems.

diagnoses.name: Turner Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: Characterized by delayed puberty in females, along with possible skin changes. Other symptoms can vary significantly.

diagnoses.name: Klinefelter Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: May present with delayed puberty in males. Skin manifestations and additional symptoms vary among individuals.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Granulomatous Disease
diagnoses.rationale: Can present with dermatological manifestations such as erythema, and may also increase susceptibility to infections, potentially explaining otitis externa.

diagnoses.name: Hyper-IgE Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: Characterized by recurrent infections (e.g., otitis externa), dermatological symptoms, including erythema, and potential delays in development.

diagnoses.name: Common Variable Immune Deficiency
diagnoses.rationale: Presents with increased susceptibility to infections. Given the range of possible infections, various symptoms like post-nasal drip or dermatological conditions could be observed.

diagnoses.name: Churg-Strauss Syndrome
diagnoses.rationale: Can include dermatological manifestations and is associated with respiratory symptoms. However, its connection to delayed puberty is indirect, linked more to overall health status.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.rationale: Characterized primarily by episodes of angioedema. While it does not directly explain all symptoms, angioedema's inclusion suggests considering it.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
diagnoses.rationale: A chronic autoimmune disease that can lead to a wide range of symptoms including skin manifestations but less directly associated with delayed puberty.

diagnoses.name: Gonadal dysgenesis
diagnoses.rationale: Directly associated with delayed puberty and can have diverse manifestations depending on genetic and environmental factors.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Rhinitis
diagnoses.rationale: While primarily associated with post-nasal drip, it's a common condition that could coincide with other symptoms in an individual, though it doesn't explain the entire symptom complex.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.reasoning: Lyme disease can cause migratory patchy macular erythema (erythema migrans) as one of its hallmark symptoms, along with potential neurological symptoms such as difficulty concentrating.

diagnoses.name: Sjögren's Syndrome
diagnoses.reasoning: This autoimmune disorder presents with dry eyes and can also lead to neurological manifestations like difficulty concentrating.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.reasoning: SLE can lead to various skin manifestations including macular erythema and neurological symptoms like difficulty concentrating.

diagnoses.name: Rosacea
diagnoses.reasoning: Rosacea can feature facial erythema and ocular involvement such as dry eyes and blepharospasm.

diagnoses.name: Blepharitis
diagnoses.reasoning: Blepharitis is an inflammation of the eyelids, which can cause blepharospasm and dry eyes.

diagnoses.name: Kawasaki Disease
diagnoses.reasoning: Though primarily affecting children, it can cause macular erythema and has been associated with cardiac complications, which might relate to Kounis syndrome indirectly.

diagnoses.name: Allergic Reaction/Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.reasoning: Severe allergic reactions can precipitate Kounis syndrome, a type of acute coronary syndrome triggered by allergic reactions.

diagnoses.name: Stress-induced Cardiomyopathy
diagnoses.reasoning: Also known as Takotsubo cardiomyopathy, this condition can overlap with symptoms of Kounis syndrome but is identified by its unique stress-related triggers.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis (MS)
diagnoses.reasoning: MS is a chronic illness that can cause neurological symptoms like difficulty concentrating and has been associated with visual disturbances, though less commonly with blepharospasm.

diagnoses.name: Drug-induced Reactions
diagnoses.reasoning: Certain medications can induce dry eyes, difficulty concentrating, blepharospasm, and skin reactions that mimic erythema. They can also potentially trigger Kounis syndrome through hypersensitivity mechanisms.

diagnoses.name: Allergic reaction
diagnoses.description: An immune system response to a foreign substance that's not typically harmful to your body. These foreign substances are called allergens. They can include certain foods, pollen, or pet dander. Your immune system's job is to keep you healthy by fighting harmful pathogens. It does this by attacking anything it thinks could put your body in danger. This response can cause hypersensitivity reactions and angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that can't be explained by any underlying medical condition. The fatigue worsens with physical or mental activity, but doesn't improve with rest. This syndrome can lead to difficulty focusing, muscle pain, and sleep disturbances, including frequent waking.

diagnoses.name: Fibromyalgia
diagnoses.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues. Researchers believe that fibromyalgia amplifies painful sensations by affecting the way your brain processes pain signals. Symptoms include muscle pain and difficulty focusing.

diagnoses.name: Sleep Apnea
diagnoses.description: A potentially serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts. Sleep apnea can cause frequent waking from sleep, leading to daytime fatigue, difficulty focusing, and can be associated with muscle pain due to poor sleep quality.

diagnoses.name: Hereditary Angioedema
diagnoses.description: A rare but serious genetic condition that causes swelling in various parts of the body, including the hands, feet, and face (angioedema). It can also lead to abdominal pain and potentially life-threatening breathing difficulties.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.description: A group of mental disorders characterized by significant feelings of anxiety and fear. Anxiety can cause muscle tension, leading to muscle pain, and can significantly affect sleep patterns, causing frequent waking. Difficulty focusing and increased vigilance can also disturb normal vision focusing mechanisms.

diagnoses.name: Hypothyroidism
diagnoses.description: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones. Hypothyroidism's symptoms include fatigue, muscle weakness, pain, difficulty focusing, and sometimes swelling of the face, which could mimic angioedema.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A disease in which the immune system eats away at the protective covering of nerves. Multiple Sclerosis can cause a wide range of symptoms, including muscle pain, difficulty with coordination and balance, and problems with vision, such as difficulty focusing vision.

diagnoses.name: Myasthenia Gravis
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune neuromuscular disease that causes weakness in the skeletal muscles, which are responsible for breathing and moving parts of the body, including the arms and legs. Symptoms can include muscle pain and difficulty focusing vision.

diagnoses.name: Lyme Disease
diagnoses.description: An infectious disease caused by the Borrelia bacterium which is spread by ticks. Early symptoms may include fever, headache, and fatigue, but it can progress to neurological problems, including difficulty focusing and muscle pain, and rarely, heart rhythm irregularities.

diagnoses.name: Kounis Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare cardiovascular disease often associated with allergic reactions that can lead to acute coronary syndromes such as myocardial infarction.

diagnoses.name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
diagnoses.description: A long-term condition where stomach contents come back up into the esophagus resulting in either symptoms or complications.

diagnoses.name: Dyshidrotic Eczema
diagnoses.description: A skin condition characterized by small blisters on the hands or feet, especially on the fingers, palms, and soles.

diagnoses.name: Acute Gastroenteritis
diagnoses.description: An inflammation of the gastrointestinal tract involving both the stomach and the small intestine resulting in vomiting and diarrhea.

diagnoses.name: Food Allergy
diagnoses.description: An immune system reaction that occurs soon after eating a certain food. Symptoms can include vomiting and other digestive problems.

diagnoses.name: Anaphylaxis
diagnoses.description: A severe, potentially life-threatening allergic reaction that can occur rapidly and affect the whole body, possibly leading to Kounis syndrome in rare instances.

diagnoses.name: Infectious Mononucleosis
diagnoses.description: Often called mono, a viral infection causing fever, sore throat, and swollen lymph glands, including those in the stomach area which may contribute to vomiting.

diagnoses.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diagnoses.description: A chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, including the skin (dyshidrotic eczema), heart (causing symptoms similar to Kounis syndrome), and digestive system.

diagnoses.name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of cancer that affects the lymphatic system, which can cause lymphadenopathy and possibly impact the body's ability to handle allergic reactions and infections.

diagnoses.name: Non-Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diagnoses.description: A type of lymphoma characterized by enlarged lymph nodes, which can be associated with systemic symptoms such as gastroesophageal reflux, skin conditions, and potentially anaphylactic reactions.

diagnoses: Inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, Ulcerative colitis)

diagnoses.name: Migraine
diagnoses.description: A neurological condition that can cause multiple symptoms including, but not limited to, severe, debilitating headaches. Symptoms may include nausea, vomiting, difficulty speaking, numbness or tingling, and sensitivity to light and sound.

diagnoses.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diagnoses.description: A chronic illness involving your central nervous system. Immune system attacks myelin, leading to demyelination. Symptoms include fatigue, difficulty walking, numbness, and muscle stiffness.

diagnoses.name: Transient Ischemic Attack
diagnoses.description: Often called a mini-stroke, a transient ischemic attack is a brief, temporary disruption of blood supply to the brain. Symptoms can mimic those of a stroke but usually last only a few minutes and cause no permanent damage.

diagnoses.name: Peripheral Neuropathy
diagnoses.description: A result of damage to the nerves located outside of the brain and spinal cord (peripheral nerves), often causes weakness, numbness and pain, usually in your hands and feet.

diagnoses.name: Vitamin B12 Deficiency
diagnoses.description: Vitamin B12 is essential for brain health, DNA production, and red blood cell development. Deficiency can lead to a wide range of neurological and psychiatric symptoms including numbness, walking difficulties, mood changes, fatigue, and memory loss.

diagnoses.name: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A rare disorder in which the body's immune system attacks the peripheral nerves. Initial symptoms include weakness and tingling in the extremities. These sensations can quickly spread, eventually paralyzing the whole body.

diagnoses.name: Stroke
diagnoses.description: Occurs when the blood supply to part of your brain is interrupted or reduced, preventing brain tissue from getting oxygen and nutrients. Brain cells begin to die in minutes. Symptoms include trouble walking, speaking, and understanding, as well as paralysis or numbness of the face, arm, or leg.

diagnoses.name: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome
diagnoses.description: A chronic pain condition most often affecting one limb (arm, leg, hand, or foot), usually after an injury. CRPS is believed to be caused by damage to, or malfunction of, the peripheral and central nervous systems. Symptoms include prolonged pain, changes in skin texture, and sensitivity to stimuli.

diagnoses.name: Anxiety Disorders
diagnoses.description: Various disorders that involve excessive fear or anxiety. Symptoms can include muscle tension, numbness in hands or feet, dizziness, and hypersensitivity to light and sound.

diagnoses.name: Fibromyalgia
diagnoses.description: A condition marked by widespread pain in the muscles and bones, areas of tenderness, and general fatigue. Symptoms are subjective and there isn't a clear known cause, which can complicate a diagnosis.

diagnoses: Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis (formerly known as Wegener's Granulomatosis)
Vasculitis associated with Hepatitis B or C
